locutie.beschrijving: The sermon explores the human experience of birth and death, philosophical arguments for immortality (Richter, Mozart, Tennyson), and the biblical account of John on Patmos encountering the Risen Christ.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Moderate. It uses the text as a narrative backdrop for existential reflection rather than a verse-by-verse exposition.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily describing the human condition and the biblical narrative, with a shift toward proclamation in the final third.
voorbeelden: Birth and death are the grand and august themes of Easter.
John could not go to his church.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Comforting the fearful and instilling hope in the face of mortality.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Low. The Spirit is not explicitly mentioned as the agent of the word's efficacy.

voorbeelden: Birth and death are the great brackets.
We are all in this thing together.
John was a prisoner on the isle of Patmos.
Let us photograph them for a moment.
I want to be guilty of that, do you not, also?
Because I live, ye shall live also.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong when quoting Scripture, but the preacher rarely initiates a commissive in his own voice.

voorbeelden: I have the keys of hell and of death.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher relies on the authority of the biblical quote rather than speaking as a mandatory.

indicatoren: Extensive philosophical reflection on poets and musicians.
Long narrative descriptions of John's historical context.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes an observer of a beautiful meditation rather than a participant in a divine encounter.

missende_elementen: Direct address of the promise to the specific congregation
Sacramental 'I' in the name of Christ
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The 'event' is postponed until the very end or remains trapped in the biblical past.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Scripture-dependent; lacks direct 'I-Thou' address from preacher to hearer.
voorbeelden: Because I live, ye shall live also.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Occasional rhetorical questions ('do you not, also?').
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Weak; used more for empathy than for delivering the promise.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominant; talking about John, Jesus, death, and philosophers.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General truths about life and death.

actueel_present.gebruik: The final proclamation of Christ's presence.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from Assertive (human death) to Commissive (Christ's promise).
voorbeelden: We reason along this path... Those who believe in Jesus have a surer faith.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The transition is slow; the 'Assertive' phase is over-extended.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions as a high-quality meditation on mortality, but remains largely constative until the very end. It talks 'about' the resurrection more than it 'performs' the resurrection for the hearer.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Birth and death, the solemn issues of our existence.
sterke_punten.effect: Hooks the listener's attention through shared human experience.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Long sections on Xenia, Ohio and Jean Paul Richter.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Delays the sacramental encounter with the Word.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It becomes an event only in the final paragraphs when the 'Fear not' is directly applied.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher acts more as a witness to a past event than a mandatory of a present grace.

openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Low; the preacher speaks as a fellow searcher ('I think', 'We reason').
tekstueel_bewijs: I think we have two distinct stakes.

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly left to the hearer's response.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Weakly realized; more of a 'reminder' of grace.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Only in the description of the Patmos vision.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Shift from 3rd person past (was/did) to 2nd person present (is/gives).

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: Those who believe in Jesus Christ have a surer faith.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: To you who believe, Jesus Christ gives a certain faith this morning.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a general description to a direct gift.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is buried in quotes.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use the preacher's voice to apply the promise directly.
voorbeeldzinnen: In the name of the Risen Christ, I tell you: your fear is defeated.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Address the 'You' of the congregation more frequently.
voorbeeldzinnen: You do not need to fear the empty chair.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Keep the current balance but strengthen the indicative's performative force.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically beautiful and existentially deep, but it needs more 'illocutionary nerve' to move from a lecture about hope to an act of hope.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' of fear; SAT focuses on the 'Declarative' power of the Word to actually remove fear.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric seeks to persuade the hearer that resurrection is plausible; SAT seeks to enact the resurrection's power in the moment of speaking.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the preacher spends 75% of the time in 'Locution' (explaining/describing) and only 5% in 'Commissive' (promising), explaining why the sermon feels more like a talk than an encounter.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'pathos' of human mortality to create a need for the 'logos' of the text.
